bug.short_desc: [1.8][compiler] strange error message for default method in class

long_desc.thetext: Moving to 4.4, will pull it up for Java 8 GA if time permits.
Shankha, please follow up, We need to split error messages to avoid confusion,

Created attachment 241092 Patch
Test Results are green.

(In reply to shankha banerjee from comment #4) > Created attachment 241130 [details] > Patch
1) Test case has been added. 2) The range of error message has been corrected.
Thanks
*** Bug 428605 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Shankha, please make sure the concerns raised in https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=428605 are addressed here. Thanks.

Srikanth, I have the fix for both the defects. Please advise where the test cases should go.
org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.compiler/src/org/eclipse/jdt/core/tests/compiler/regression/InterfaceMethodsTest.java
Seems to be right one, but this only has tests pertaining to 1.8.
Thanks

(In reply to shankha banerjee from comment #8) > Srikanth, > I have the fix for both the defects. Please advise where the test cases > should go. > > org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.compiler/src/org/eclipse/jdt/core/tests/compiler/ > regression/InterfaceMethodsTest.java > > Seems to be right one, but this only has tests pertaining to 1.8.
This is the right place, why is it an issue that it has only tests for 1.8 ? After all, the present topic is also 1.8 ?

Created attachment 241356 Patch
Test Results are green. This patch handles both the bugs.
Jay, please review this patch and help take it forward. Thanks!

Just a minor comment:
1. In ProblemReporter#defaultModifierIllegallySpecified, the String[] can be pulled into a local variable.
Also noticed that for static interface methods, we report two errors, once from Parser and another from MethodScope#checkAndSetModifiersForMethod(). This is only the case for static and not for default. But I guess we can live with this, at least not in the scope of this bug.

Created attachment 241980 Patch
Patch with review comments incorporated. Tests results are green.
Thanks

(In reply to Jayaprakash Arthanareeswaran from comment #12) > Just a minor comment: > > 1. In ProblemReporter#defaultModifierIllegallySpecified, the String[] can be > pulled into a local variable.
Sorry, that was a wrong suggestion. What is correct is that there is no need for those argument. You can simply leave it as is (NoArgument) as the message doesn't take any arguments.

Created attachment 242042 Patch
Patch. This takes care of comment 14 + few other changes (ProblemReporter.java#defaultModifierIllegallySpecified). Tests Cases are green.
For the change in ComplianceDiagnoseTest.java#testBug399780, please see Bug 431374.
Thanks

Thanks Shankha, I have released the fix in master via:
http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/?id=c25147722035f2a05a7377305b87e55b9926d02e
Verified for 4.4 M7 using I20140428-2000 build
